author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1618244008}
review:
"Dream Factory" ist ein Filmstudio Manager.

Und das nächste Meisterwerk dieses Entwicklers, das sich im Early-Access festgefressen hat. Die letzte Update-Meldung gab es im November 2015, also praktisch mit Release.

Wir managen ein Filmstudio. Ähnlich wie bei Spielen im Stile von Prison Architect müssen wir aber erstmal Gebäude bauen, Zonen zuweisen und Gegenstände platzieren. Dann strellen wir Storyschreiber, Regisseure und Schauspieler ein und hoffen, daß am Ende gute Filme herauskommen.

Das wäre alles eine ziemlich gute und witzige (wenn auch nicht neue Idee) wenn denn irgendwas an dem Game funktionieren würde. Es scheitert schon am Bauen. Wenn wir unser erstes selbstgezimmertes Gebäude hochziehen, legen die Arbeiter zwar Fliesen, aber können nicht auf allen Außenfliesen Wände hinbauen. Weshalb bleibt schleierhaft. Herausfinden kann man das aber nur, wenn man ungefähr eine halbe Stunde gewartet hat, denn die Spielfiguren bewegen sich nur im Normaltempo. Wollen wir das Ganze beschleunigen buggen sich alle Figuren sofort an ihrem Standort fest. 

Wahrscheinlich sind die meisten gar nicht mal soweit gekommen, die ganzen Bugs zu erleben, weil man einfach viel zu lange auf sie warten muß. Und Bugs gibt es viele und zahlreiche. Gegenstände können nicht platziert werden oder haben gar keine Funktion, angestellte Leute sind völlig planlos und machen einfach gar nichts und währenddessen tickt unser Konto auf Null. 

Gut, jetzt werden manche einwenden, genau so liefe es bei den meisten Filmproduktionsfirmen wirklich ab, das sei nur realistisch. Aber diesen Einwand kann ich selbst aus Ironieperspektive nicht gelten lassen, denn dafür ist das Produkt einfach ein zu deutliches Gar Nichts.

Das Ding ist nicht mal in einem Alpha-Status. Es sind wild zusammengewürfelte Ideen, die allesamt nicht fertig programmiert sind und nicht funktionieren. Das Ding ist wirklich nur für die Tonne.  

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
1/10 Atmosphäre
-/10 Story
1/10 Grafik
1/10 Sound
0/10 Spielmechanik
0/10 Balancing
0/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Abgedreht: Das letzte Update gab es Ende 2015...

[h1][b]0/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198041581811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1517412273}
review:
I bought this game on sale from Humble Store for £0.53, and I overpaid. This game doesn't even function properly as a game.

The game claims to be in early access, but there has been no update from the developers in over 2 years, so it's safe to assume it's been abandoned.

The premise is great, a film studio management game, but you are unable to actually produce any films.

Firstly, the construction is really clunky. After placing walls, there is no clear way to remove them until after they've been built, but the AI doesn't seem to be able to build anything for whatever reason.

There are 3 speed settings, paused, normal, and fast. Pause and normal work as you would expect, but the fast setting doesn't appear to change the speed of the game at all.

There is no way I found to open a pause menu where you could save your progress, or quit the game. I had to exit by alt-tabbing out of the game and force closing it from the taskbar.

When you click to start writing a new script, even after hiring a screenwriter, you are unable to select one to actually begin the process. I wish I could give a more in-depth view of the rest of the gameplay, but I couldn't get to any of it.

It has trading cards (what game doesn't these days), and that seems to be about the only thing about the game that actually works as intended.

0/10

Don't even bother. 0/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197987123233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1501646329}
review: Can't currently recommend this game. Didn't play it for too long, but the problems are apparent. As the free version of Unity was used, I can't see this game having a big budget at the beginning. However, I can see the potential. I like manager-build games. The game was seemingly inspired by Prison Architect. But unlike PA, the game needs a more consistent Art Style. Currently the rooms and the map have one style, the props another and the workers yet another different style. Personally I'd keep to the more simple PA style as in the map and rooms. Second big thing that I noticed is, that if you speed up the game, the workers just block each other and turn in circles. As others have pointed out, there is no sound. I am not bothered by this, however it should be added in the future. As someone who played PA for a bit, I was familiar with how to proceed, but a tutorial for new players would be nice. All in all, I want this game to suceed but currently I cannot recommend this at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094165039', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1491844694}
review:
I purchased this game on sale for 99 cents after I sold a foil card for 75 cents, so I only spent 24 cents on it, and yet, I feel like it's not even worth that. I almost want to ask for a refund of my 99 cents so I can forever cleanse my palette of this awful disaster of game design- if you can even call it that. There is no tutorial, not tool tips, and nothing seems remotely understandable. There are times I wanted to restart my game and hitting ESC didn't even work, so I had to end progress in task manager to close the game. The sound isn't working, and I'm not even sure if it's supposed to work or not, because there is no options menu. I tried to dive straight in, to see if I could figure it out on my own, and before I could even get a room made the workers started to complain of having no bushes to pee in. I didn't even know I was supposed to make a bathroom or kitchen for these guys because I thought the game was about making movies. I can't tell what tiles I'm placing down until the workers get done building it, and there were times I restarted the game and old tiles or supply crates were still there and I couldn't demolish or build in those spots. I had to get out of build mode by right clicking before I could click to close the little pop-ups saying they needed to pee and eat, because if I didn't, I would accidentally click and place a build square. I couldn't stop them from building something until after they got done building it, meaning I lost the money used to build in that square.

I enjoyed the sepia tone colors and the strange characters when I first saw this game and hoped it would be enjoyable. I'm just glad I didn't waste a full $10 on this game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198009527661', 'num_games_owned': 1453, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1489601687}
review:
Une pale copie de Prison architect sans la couleur, sans les tutos, sans scénarios, sans objectifs, sans options, sans fun, sans saveurs, mais avec des bugs à la pelle et un système de construction souffrant lui aussi de bugs (10 min pour arriver à faire enfin construire une salle, les ouvriers se balladent dans tous les sens, se figent lorsqu'on accèlère le temps, se bloque dans les coins, ramène des matériaux de constructions et reste devant voir si le batiment se construit tout seul)
Le jeu est en early acces ... depuis presque 2ans et les devs semblent avoir quitté le navire peu après le lancemment de celui ci.
Coté jeux sur le cinéma je n'ai rien à vous conseiller par contre dans le style jeu de construction/gestion prison architect est un très bon titre et abordable.
Heureusemment que ce jeu ne ma couté que 0,5€

author: {'steamid': '76561198210050417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1486297629}
review:
I laughed too hard at this. The art style looks almost identical to Papers, Please. Every NPC looks they're terrified of some kind of cosmic horror off-screen. But they also tried to copy the Prison Architect no-arms art style as well, and the graphics are so realistic it looks like a bunch of quadruple amputees are hopping around and building stuff. And if thats not enough if you try and hit fast forward all the nugget people will freeze and start gyrating at high speeds, doing an erotic dance for their overlord. And the overall goal of the game I guess is to film as much nugget pr0n as you can? 

Unfortunately this means that you have to play at normal speed and the nuggets are so horribly slow it takes the patience of a saint to even get it to the point where you can make a film. I don't even think the creators have played it through themselves because I lost 100k and 20 minutes just waiting for them to build two very small buildings.

But THAT DOESN'T MATTER!! Because this is the first game that allows the nuggets to take control. Nugget pr0n by the nuggets, for the nuggets! Great game 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197989591969', 'num_games_owned': 4091, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1485258137}
review:
You know how with some Early Access games they're a bit rough around the edges....and you can see that the developer has a brilliant idea and just needs time and money to polish up and make a finished product?

This isn't one of those games.

After being presented with a menu screen with two options (Start or Quit - no settings whatsoever) you're dumped straight into the game. There's no tutorial, no clue about what you're supposed to be doing, and the "advisor" shouting at you that things are going wrong. The UI is VERY unintuitive, there's no sound and the graphics are grim and awful. So much for the glamour of Hollywood.

I'm not sure where the "humour and irony" the developers are claiming is present...unless it's in the sense that the game is the exact opposite of what it's supposed to be? It's drab, pointless, and above all...no fun.

I'd like to hope that this is just a version 0.0.0.0.0.0.0.1 or something, but apparently it's been like this for months now with no signs of development.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984780286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1479736338}
review:
This game is as buggy as can be:

You can not build Rooms properly: Workers can (and will) get stuck trying to find a way to place down a wall/floor tile. This happens very regularly, making the game unplayable.

[list]
[*]There is no sound or music implemented.
[*]There is no tutorial (and there should be at least an option to read a help file)
[*]There is no color. Everything has this grey-brown style, looking like an old scroll and thus creating an unnecessary gloomy atmosphere,
[*]There is no visible progress on this software to bee seen. Not even a note that this project has been canceled or is still being worked on or anything at all.
[/list]

To sum it up: For 15 Bucks you get absolutely nothing. You can't do anything in this game (yet? ... still?) and it seems to me like this won't change in the future. If you have paid for this (like i did) you have been clearly ripped off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317566157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1479142745}
review: НАВИД ВАНЁЧАЯ ИГРА ПЛОХАЯ ГРАФИКА НО ТАК ИГРА ЗАТЯГИВАЕТ Я НЕ ПОНИМАЛ СМЫСЛ А ТЕПЕРЬ ТОЛЬКО СЕГОДНЯ ПОНЕЛ Я НЕ ПОНЕЛ ЧТО ОНИ ХОДЯТ КАК РАЗВИЫВАТСЯ НО СЁДНЯ Я ПОНЕЛ ВОТ ЩЯС БУДУ НАИГРЫВАТЬ НЕ ЗРЯ Я ЕЁ КУПИЛ

author: {'steamid': '76561198042626922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1518061536}
review:
I wrote a review about this game last year when Dream Factory came out and now writing a new one with new thoughts.

Originally the game was a mess on release but the developers quickly made a patch and fixed some of the problems that were pointed out making it a bit more playable though there was a million problems left to go.

Then nothing further happened and that is where we are today, buyers get a game that had potential but is too riddled with problems to play hour after hour.

Workers get stuck, build orders sometimes don't get carried out, making a movie becomes a problem because virtually 3/4 of the options are in Russian or are gibberish and a whole lot more other problems mentioned in other reviews pop up too.

It is recommended that you do not speed up the game, it causes the workers to get stuck, regular speed does allow some play but there is no certainty that workers will not get stuck again, sometimes building a new building close by unsticks them.

Game time does not matter as the date and time does not match as days change every couple of minutes on the clock.

You cannot write over save games so you have to save the name in a new slot every time.

What is very concerning is that it seems the developers left this game behind to make Cyber Team Manager and then went on to make a game called The Legions of Rome.

Cyber Team Manager has the same complaints as Dream Factory and they missed their target of a February 2017 update and blaming Unity problems for the previous lack of updates.

The Legions of Rome that is that is considered unplayable and the current game is rating better than DF and CM but it has been untouched for quite some time.

So there you have it, Dream Factory is a do not buy at any price game unless you have to have it in your Hall of Shame collection or feel like you want your patience severely tested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069045811', 'num_games_owned': 2458, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1475475597}
review:
This could have been something great, but as it stands, is completely abandoned. The last update was pushed July of last year, and the developer at one time seemed to enlist one of his customers in fixing the game(you can find thier back and forth on the discussions forum).

This could be something great, and would be nice for a free tech demo attahed to something like kickstarter, but is completely unbalanced and broken. No matter what genere you select, ALL MOVIES ARE SCI-FI, and that's when you can figure out HOW to actually do anything. The first time I booted this game I quit out in frustration after not being able to buld anything.

The second go, I somehow figured out how to place rooms, buildings and equipment, but the menu and janky movement broke everything for me. It seems all game actors move on 2.5 game "minute" intervals, and speeding things up breaks everything. The actual screenwriting menues are nice, and it looks like this could have some promise, but again, nothing here is completed.

None of the development promises have even hinted at being met. It seems after the first bugfix(coincidentially, a couple of weeks after this was released), this was all but abandoned.

Do NOT purchse this game untill the dev decides to push something playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021246623', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1475336870}
review:
I bought this game for $0.74 on the Humble Store. 95% off, and I'm thinking, cool, I'll get a half hour/45 minutes of entertainment out of this, and get to justify the charge by telling myself like 3 cents goes to charity. Redeem it, 12 second download, and I'm like LETS DO THIS.

Well guess who was not ready to do this. I start it up, main menu has 3 options that I can choose (one is greyed out): New Game, Load Game, and Exit. Alright, sure, let's start a new game. Game starts, and........... "Uhhh.... what do I do?" I see at the bottom that it has these icons so I click them, one says "Add a floor." So I try to add a floor. Nope. Can't do it. "How about a wall?" I naively ask myself. Nope, won't let me do that either. "Okay.. maybe I should check the interwebs for a wiki or something." So I hit Esc. Nothing happens. Uhh... F1? Nope. F2. F3. F4. Tab. Space. Enter. I smash all the keys on my keyboard to the point that the keys that are stuck from spillage are now unstuck. 

"WHAT??" I Alt-Tab my ass out of there and decide "Let me check for a wiki, maybe I'm just an idiot." A cursory google search reveals that I am, in fact, an idiot. Had I check the Steam reviews for this game beforehand, I would not have spent the $0.74. 

This game is not Early Access. It is a concept that has not actually turned into anything truly resembling a game yet. Like HOW DO YOU NOT HAVE A WAY TO QUIT YOUR GAME??? (While I do have to admit this could be a good way to keep people playing your game forever, I do not recommend it if you do not have a game for them to play.)
So take my mistake, and learn from it. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. DO NOT BUY ANY GAME, NO MATTER HOW CHEAP, WITHOUT READING REVIEWS ABOUT IT FIRST. 

If they update this software to actually be a game, I may change my review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057334690', 'num_games_owned': 2528, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1466843273}
review:
Да данный момент игра неиграбельна, приведу краткий список проблем, с которыми столкнулся:
- нет звука
- при ускорении игры на максимум все персонажи стоят на месте и крутятся из стороны в сторону
- уведомления закрывают всё панель инструментов, если их много
- если ты поставил "пол", то дверь на эту клетку уже не поставить
- невозможно отменить строительство на клетке: указал стену не там - начинай заново
- рабочие застревают, если указать строить стены по контуру и оставить 1 клетку для будущей двери
- по неведомым причинам рабочие иногда отказываются строить что либо

Не смог построить ни одного здания за час - вышел из игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276798449', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1466620955}
review:
Меня хотят убедить, что это симулятор Киноиндустрии, а я всё же считаю, что тюрьмы) Посудите сами, рабочие не могут по своему желанию поссать... Им нужно разрешение, а также желательно ткнуть их носом, куда это можно сделать. А если этого места нет, то его нужно поставить.
Игре нужно развиваться, а разработчику дополнять её контентом, т.к. много пока не моняно как делать. Или обучение сделать...

author: {'steamid': '76561198056326988', 'num_games_owned': 3846, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1466628261}
review:
Довольно странная игра.
1) Тут нет тренировки
2) Не отнимаются деньги за покупку объектов.
3) Потратился, столкнулся с проблемой пописать, начал новую игру - сразу сняли деньги. ???
4) Проблема пописать - рабочие захотели пописать, но нет кустов. Ищу кусты в объектах - нету. Только потом заметил, что там 2 фонтана и 1 из них похож на куст.
5) Хз как записывать фильм - нет сценария. А для записи сценария нужен сценарист, а его и нету. Где он нанимается - тоже большой вопрос.

Буду ждать тренировку.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061066803', 'num_games_owned': 3431, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1466752538}
review: Безусловно игре еще предстоит долгий путь, чтобы выйти из раннего доступа. Если не обращать внимание на графику, и на не большое количество контента, то в общем и целом не так все плохо. Это что-то типа симулятора продюсера кинофильмов, со всеми вытекающими, игра в которой вы побываете, так сказать за кулисами, ощутите вкус внутренней кухни киноиндустрии, начиная от создания собственной студии!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098942259', 'num_games_owned': 9622, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1487558956}
review:
I have to say this is truly terrible, atleast from my point of view.
So from what i seen of the game it looked like my sort of thing, however within the first minute of playing i hated it.

Now i understand this is early access but this has a looooooong way to go to make this any good, il explain.

There are no options meaning you cant setup any controls, sounds or graphics or anything else.
You have the choice to start new or load/save thats it.
So you begin the game and first thing you notice theres zero sound, no sound fx, no soundtrack nothing, weird.
Next you think ok what do i do, no tutorial or directions, just a build menu on your bottom left, money on your top left, time in the central top and date top right, thats pretty much it.

So after looking through the build menu you start to slowly figure the usual stuff out, however attempting to build your first wall is a challenge on its own, not only do the builders give up half way the walls dont even show! Theres constant popups from the start that say your workers are hungry, your workers need a pee which means they wont do anything until you build toilets/kitchen etc i mean you cant even start the damn game.

Another time i couldnt even place furniture in a room, no placement, workers dont work, no sound, objects dont show on map at times, i didnt even get to trying a film out but nevermind.

Seriously tho, this game is not ready to be even early access, in its current state i wouldnt even give this game away, let alone pay the current price, and its a shame, i just hope things change sooner rather than later otherwise i can see this being a game that never leaves early access.

So im sorry but really cant recommend it to anyone.

I will attempt this game again in the future and hopefully give it a much better review than now, good luck!
